metadata.description: The name you provide will be appended with a unique sting to make it globally available. The name can contain only letters, numbers and hyphens. The first and last characters must be a letter or number. Spaces are not allowed.
The name you provide will be appended with a unique sting to make it globally available. The field can contain only lowercase letters and numbers. Name must be between 1 and 11 characters.
Location of the data factory. Currently, only East US, East US 2, and West Europe are supported.
Please specify if you want to write curated data into SQL database.

The name you provide will be appended with a unique sting to make it globally available. Your server name can contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and '-', but can't start or end with '-' or have more than 50 characters.
Value should not match special patterns. It should contain a length of maximum of 128.

Your login name must not contain a SQL Identifier or a typical system name (like admin, administrator, sa, root, dbmanager, loginmanager, etc.) or a built-in database user or role (like dbo, guest, public, etc.)

Your password must be at least 8 characters in length. Your password must contain characters from three of the following categories â€“ English uppercase letters, English lowercase letters, numbers (0-9), and non-alphanumeric characters (!, $, #, %, etc.) Your password cannot contain all or part of the login name. Part of a login name is defined as three or more consecutive alphanumeric characters.
Please specify comma separated email addresses on which you would like to receive the ADF pipeline alerts.

typeProperties.script:
parameters{
	filename as string ('covid_tracking'),
	runid as string ('runtime_guid')
}
source(output(
		OBJECTID as string,
		X as string,
		Y as string,
		HOSPITAL_NAME as string,
		HOSPITAL_TYPE as string,
		HQ_ADDRESS as string,
		HQ_ADDRESS1 as string,
		HQ_CITYString as string,
		HQ_STATE as string,
		HQ_ZIP_CODE as string,
		COUNTY_NAME as string,
		STATE_NAME as string,
		STATE_FIPS as string,
		CNTY_FIPS as string,
		FIPS as string,
		NUM_LICENSED_BEDS as string,
		NUM_STAFFED_BEDS as string,
		NUM_ICU_BEDS as string,
		ADULT_ICU_BEDS as string,
		PEDI_ICU_BEDS as string,
		BED_UTILIZATION as string,
		Potential_Increase_In_Bed_Capac as string,
		AVG_VENTILATOR_USAGE as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	rowUrlColumn: 'lineage',
	inferDriftedColumnTypes: true) ~> sourceCSV
roundOffLatAndLong select(mapColumn(
		Row_ID,
		Load_Date,
		Load_Time,
		Longitude,
		Latitude,
		Hospital_Name,
		Hospital_Type,
		Hq_Address,
		Hq_Address1,
		Hq_Citystring,
		Hq_State,
		Hq_Zip_Code,
		County_Name,
		State_Name,
		State_Fips,
		Cnty_Fips,
		Fips,
		Num_Licensed_Beds,
		Num_Staffed_Beds,
		Num_Icu_Beds,
		Adult_Icu_Beds,
		Pedi_Icu_Beds,
		Bed_Utilization,
		Potential_Increase_In_Bed_Capac,
		Avg_Ventilator_Usage
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> DropLineageColumn
sourceCSV derive(load_time = currentTimestamp(),
		load_date = currentDate()) ~> LoadDateAndLoadTimestamp
LoadDateAndLoadTimestamp select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace(initCap(regexReplace($$,'_',' ')),' ','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> ModifyHeadingStyle
ModifyHeadingStyle select(mapColumn(
		Row_ID = Objectid,
		Load_Date,
		Load_Time,
		Longitude = X,
		Latitude = Y,
		Hospital_Name,
		Hospital_Type,
		Hq_Address,
		Hq_Address1,
		Hq_Citystring,
		Hq_State,
		Hq_Zip_Code,
		County_Name,
		State_Name,
		State_Fips,
		Cnty_Fips,
		Fips,
		Num_Licensed_Beds,
		Num_Staffed_Beds,
		Num_Icu_Beds,
		Adult_Icu_Beds,
		Pedi_Icu_Beds,
		Bed_Utilization,
		Potential_Increase_In_Bed_Capac,
		Avg_Ventilator_Usage,
		Lineage
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> RenameAndRearrange
RenameAndRearrange derive(Longitude = round(toDouble(Longitude),3),
		Latitude = round(toDouble(Latitude),3)) ~> roundOffLatAndLong
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.csv'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SinkLatestCSV
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.jsonl'))],
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkLatestJsonl
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.csv'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SinkCSV
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.jsonl'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkJsonl
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.parquet'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkLatestParquet
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.parquet'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkParquet
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	format: 'table',
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkSQL

ifTrueActivities.name: Alert Current Schema Has Less Columns
Alert Current Schema Has More Columns
Alert Equal Number But Different Names Or Arrangement

activities.name: Alert If Change In Data Type

dependsOn.activity: Alert If Change In Data Type

sink.preCopyScript:
IF OBJECT_ID('[retain_schema].[compare_datatype_change]', 'U') IS NOT NULL

BEGIN

DROP TABLE [retain_schema].[compare_datatype_change];

END

IF OBJECT_ID('[save_schema].[detect_datatype_change]', 'U') IS NOT NULL

BEGIN

DROP TABLE [save_schema].[detect_datatype_change]; 

END

ifTrueActivities.name: Alert Current Schema Has Less Columns
Alert Current Schema Has More Columns
Alert Equal Number But Different Names Or Arrangement

properties.description: It is to notify that the current schema of the source has less column(s) than the schema of the same source previously detected.

dimensions.name: Name
values: Alert Current Schema Has Less Columns

properties.description: It is to notify that the current schema of the source has more column(s) than the schema of the same source previously detected.

dimensions.name: Name
values: Alert Current Schema Has More Columns

properties.description: It is to notify that the current schema of the source has same number of columns as the schema of the same source previously detected but either the arrangement of the columns is different or one or more columns have different names.

dimensions.name: Name
values: Alert Equal Number But Different Names Or Arrangement

properties.description: Change in data type for one or more column(s) has been detected in the sql table
Metric alert for activity failure in a pipeline
Metric alert for activity run cancellation in a pipeline
Metric alert for trigger failed runs
Metric alert for activity failure in a pipeline
Metric alert for activity cancellation in a pipeline
Metric alert for pipeline trigger failure
Metric alert for pipeline trigger cancellation
